page.title: 08 FARMING
page.content: The farms in this area are small ones. The main type of farming is dairy though some farmers are beginning to change. A milk tanker collects the milk every day. Most crops are for animal feed. A lot of grass is made into silage and some hay is also made. There is a small amount of corn grown and an increaing amount of oil seed rape. Some farmland in the North-west of the block has been lost owing to the building of the dam for the Carsington Reservoir. The trees have been cleared and now the land is lying bare waiting to be flooded. Two farmhouses will be under the water eventually, and a lot of good farmland. The farms do not employ many workers. Some smallholdings are run by people who have other employment as well, others employ mainly family.
